DOC.brief_title: Likely Use PrEP African American YMSM
DOC.detailed_description: This study use exploratory , naturalistic qualitative design participant interview collect data emotional cognitive process ( illness representation ) response threat potential HIV infection , factor ( social , cultural , individual characteristic , experience health care ) influence likely use PrEP . The sample study include 20 30 African American YMSM , age 16-24 , reside Durham , Wake , Orange counties North Carolina . The in-depth interview guide 26-item descriptive survey PrEP Knowledge , Sexual History , Demographic Instrument develop study use combination concept adapt Common Sense Model Illness Representation ( CSM ) question adapt Adolescent Trial Network 's ( ATN ) 082 study 's questionnaire . Participants ask question relate African American YMSM 's likely use HIV Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis ( PrEP ) HIV risk-reduction strategy . Once informed consent obtain , interview commence study participant individually interview discuss factor influence likely use PrEP . Each participant complete descriptive survey one-on-one interview .
